title: [bugfix] Rewrote project_to_plane() in PerspectiveCamera for draw_domain(), fixes #997

content.raw:
Because PerspectiveCamera has a direction of view, in some special cases, some domain corners may be located behind the camera. But they can not be simply removed, as they may connect to other corners within the image, which produces visible domain edge.

So my treatment is to put these corners to infinity, so their perspective projections on the image plane will not fall onto the image, but they may still connect to other corners and produce visible domain edge within the image...
content.html:
Because PerspectiveCamera has a direction of view, in some special cases, some domain corners may be located behind the camera. But they can not be simply removed, as they may connect to other corners within the image, which produces visible domain edge.

So my treatment is to put these corners to infinity, so their perspective projections on the image plane will not fall onto the image, but they may still connect to other corners and produce visible domain edge within the image...

content.raw: yes, that makes the movie look correct, but as you note, we are LHS now.  I guess that's the better of two evils, so maybe we should commit this back until we can go through everything and make it consistently RHS.  It's a little misleading to users to do it LHS, but atleast it's consistent.
content.html: yes, that makes the movie look correct, but as you note, we are LHS now. I guess that's the better of two evils, so maybe we should commit this back until we can go through everything and make it consistently RHS. It's a little misleading to users to do it LHS, but atleast it's consistent.
